text: Major-General Chaim Herzog (; 17 September 1918 â€“ 17 April 1997) was an Israeli politician, general, lawyer and author. He was head of the Military Intelligence Directorate (Aman) in 1949-1950 and 1959-1962, and was the sixth President of Israel between 1983 and 1993. His son, Isaac Herzog, is the 11th President of Israel. Herzog died on 17 April 1997 in Tel Aviv, Israel from heart failure caused by pneumonia at the age of 78. ==References== Category:1918 births Category:1997 deaths Category:Directors of Israeli intelligence agencies Category:Israeli generals Category:Israeli lawyers Category:Jewish Israeli politicians Category:Israeli historians Category:Jewish military people Category:People from Belfast Category:Presidents of Israel
